meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Chenopodium, used as a vermifuge.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted wormseed in the garden to help get rid of worms in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The herbalist recommended wormseed to treat the worm infestation in the dog.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the wormseed plant was a new type of snack.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was like wormseed, always seeking to remove the unwanted pests from her plants.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of wormseed filled the air, promising relief from the pesky worms.

meanings.definition: The seeds of the wormseed plant, used as a vermifuge.
meanings.sent1: She ground up wormseed to make a natural remedy for the worm infection.
meanings.sent2: The medicine contained wormseed, known for its effectiveness against worms.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly added wormseed to the recipe, creating a unique flavor twist.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the wormseed seeds symbolized the power to cleanse and purify.
meanings.sent5: As she sprinkled wormseed seeds in the garden, she felt a sense of control over the worm population.
